standard_metadata.standard_description: Classify two-dimensional figures based on the presence or absence of parallel or perpendicular lines, or the presence or absence of angles of a specified size. Recognize right triangles as a category, and identify right triangles.
standard_metadata.standard_title: Classify triangles by both sides and angles

question.content: **Classify $\triangle{ABC}$ by its side lengths and by its angles.**

images.alt: A triangle ABC with side lengths of 4 millimeters, 7 millimeters, and 5 millimeters. There is 1 obtuse angle and 2 acute angles.

hints.content: We can classify triangles by their sides and their angles.

###Sides  An $\blueD{\text{equilateral}}$ triangle has  $\blueD{3\text{ equal sides}}$.   An  $\purpleC{\text{isosceles}}$  triangle has _at least_ $\purpleC{2\text{ equal sides}}$.  A  $\greenD{\text{scalene}}$ triangle has $\greenD{0\text{ equal sides}}$.
**How many sides of equal length does $\triangle{ABC}$ have?**  $\triangle{ABC}$ has $\greenD{0\text{ equal sides}}$, so it is a $\greenD{\text{scalene}}$ triangle.

###Angles  An $\goldE{\text{acute}}$ triangle has  $\goldE{3}$ angles that measure $\goldE{\text{less than } 90^\circ}$.   A  $\tealD{\text{right}}$  triangle has  $\tealD{1}$ angle that measures $\tealD{90^\circ}$.  An $\maroonD{\text{obtuse}}$ triangle has  $\maroonD{1}$  angle that measures $\maroonD{\text{more than } 90^\circ}$.

**What are the measures of $\triangle{ABC}$'s angles?**   [[â˜ƒ image 1]]  $\triangle{ABC}$ has $\maroonD{1}$  angle that measures $\maroonD{\text{more than } 90^\circ}$so it is an $\maroonD{\text{obtuse}}$ triangle.

images.alt: A triangle ABC with side lengths of 4 millimeters, 7 millimeters, and 5 millimeters and angle measures of 42 degrees, 104 degrees, and 34 degrees.

hints.content: $\triangle{ABC}$ is a $\greenD{\text{scalene}}$ triangle and an  $\maroonD{\text{obtuse}}$ triangle.

question.content: **Classify $\triangle{LMN}$ by its side lengths and by its angles.**

images.alt: A triangle LMN with side lengths of 5 centimeters, 4 centimeters, and 5 centimeters. There are 3 acute angles.

hints.content: We can classify triangles by their sides and their angles.

###Sides  An $\blueD{\text{equilateral}}$ triangle has  $\blueD{3\text{ equal sides}}$.   An  $\purpleC{\text{isosceles}}$  triangle has _at least_ $\purpleC{2\text{ equal sides}}$.  A  $\greenD{\text{scalene}}$ triangle has $\greenD{0\text{ equal sides}}$.
**How many sides of equal length does $\triangle{LMN}$ have?**  $\triangle{LMN}$ has _at least_ $\purpleC{2\text{ equal sides}}$, so it is a $\purpleC{\text{isosceles}}$ triangle.

###Angles  An $\goldE{\text{acute}}$ triangle has  $\goldE{3}$ angles that measure $\goldE{\text{less than } 90^\circ}$.   A  $\tealD{\text{right}}$  triangle has  $\tealD{1}$ angle that measures $\tealD{90^\circ}$.  An $\maroonD{\text{obtuse}}$ triangle has  $\maroonD{1}$  angle that measures $\maroonD{\text{more than } 90^\circ}$.

**What are the measures of $\triangle{LMN}$'s angles?**  [[â˜ƒ image 1]]  $\triangle{LMN}$ has $\goldE{3}$  angles that measures $\goldE{\text{less than } 90^\circ}$ so it is an $\goldE{\text{acute}}$ triangle.

images.alt: A triangle LMN with side lengths of 5 centimeters, 4 centimeters, and 5 centimeters and angle measures of 44 degrees, 68 degrees, and 68 degrees.

hints.content: $\triangle{LMN}$ is an $\purpleC{\text{isosceles}}$ triangle and an  $\goldE{\text{acute}}$ triangle.

question.content: **Classify $\triangle{XYZ}$ by its side lengths and by its angles.**

images.alt: A triangle XYZ with side lengths of 9 meters, 15 meters, and 12 meters. There is 1 right angle and 2 acute angles.

hints.content: We can classify triangles by their sides and their angles.

###Sides  An $\blueD{\text{equilateral}}$ triangle has  $\blueD{3\text{ equal sides}}$.   An  $\purpleC{\text{isosceles}}$  triangle has _at least_ $\purpleC{2\text{ equal sides}}$.  A  $\greenD{\text{scalene}}$ triangle has $\greenD{0\text{ equal sides}}$.
**How many sides of equal length does $\triangle{XYZ}$ have?**  $\triangle{XYZ}$ has  $\greenD{0\text{ equal sides}}$, so it is a $\greenD{\text{scalene}}$ triangle.

###Angles  An $\goldE{\text{acute}}$ triangle has  $\goldE{3}$ angles that measure $\goldE{\text{less than } 90^\circ}$.   A  $\tealD{\text{right}}$  triangle has  $\tealD{1}$ angle that measures $\tealD{90^\circ}$.  An $\maroonD{\text{obtuse}}$ triangle has  $\maroonD{1}$  angle that measures $\maroonD{\text{more than } 90^\circ}$.
**What are the measures of $\triangle{XYZ}$'s angles?**  [[â˜ƒ image 1]]  $\triangle{XYZ}$ has $\tealD{1}$  angle that measures $\tealD{90^\circ}$ so it is an $\tealD{\text{right}}$ triangle.

images.alt: A triangle XYZ with side lengths of 9 meters, 15 meters, and 12 meters and angle measures of 90 degrees, 54 degrees, and 36 degrees.

hints.content: $\triangle{XYZ}$ is a $\greenD{\text{scalene}}$ triangle and an  $\tealD{\text{right}}$ triangle.

question.content: **Classify $\triangle{RST}$ by its side lengths and by its angles.**

images.alt: A triangle RST with side lengths of 8 meters, 8 meters, and 8 meters. There are 3 acute angles.

hints.content: We can classify triangles by their sides and their angles.

###Sides  An $\blueD{\text{equilateral}}$ triangle has  $\blueD{3\text{ equal sides}}$.   An  $\purpleC{\text{isosceles}}$  triangle has _at least_ $\purpleC{2\text{ equal sides}}$.  A  $\greenD{\text{scalene}}$ triangle has $\greenD{0\text{ equal sides}}$.

**How many sides of equal length does $\triangle{RST}$ have?**  $\triangle{RST}$ has _at least_ $\purpleC{2\text{ equal sides}}$, so it is a $\purpleC{\text{isosceles}}$ triangle. It also has $\blueD{3\text{ equal sides}}$, so it is a $\blueD{\text{equilateral}}$ triangle.  $\triangle{RST}$  is both an $\purpleC{\text{isosceles}}$ triangle and $\blueD{\text{equilateral}}$ triangle.

###Angles  An $\goldE{\text{acute}}$ triangle has  $\goldE{3}$ angles that measure $\goldE{\text{less than } 90^\circ}$.   A  $\tealD{\text{right}}$  triangle has  $\tealD{1}$ angle that measures $\tealD{90^\circ}$.  An $\maroonD{\text{obtuse}}$ triangle has  $\maroonD{1}$  angle that measures $\maroonD{\text{more than } 90^\circ}$.

**What are the measures of $\triangle{RST}$'s angles?**  [[â˜ƒ image 1]]  $\triangle{RST}$ has $\goldE{3}$  angles that measures $\goldE{\text{less than } 90^\circ}$ so it is an $\goldE{\text{acute}}$ triangle.

images.alt: A triangle RST with side lengths of 8 meters, 8 meters, and 8 meters and angle measures of 60 degrees, 60 degrees, and 60 degrees.

hints.content: $\triangle{RST}$ is a $\blueD{\text{equilateral}}$ triangle, $\purpleC{\text{isosceles}}$ triangle,  and an  $\goldE{\text{acute}}$ triangle.
